publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7802 Aileen Campbell: Scottish Short Films Accepted for New York Independent Film Festival—That the Parliament congratulates Soundsmove Productions and Lesmahagow-based director, David Goodall, on having two short films accepted for competition in the New York Independent Film Festival, which is scheduled to take place in April 2011; notes that the films, Crush and Changed Days, deal with the sensitive topics of abuse in teenage relationships and the effects of Alzheimer’s disease respectively; further notes that Crush is currently being used by the Reduce Abuse Project in schools in Scotland and that Changed Days has been used by North Dementia Forum in Scotland, Alzheimer’s Scotland and other bodies, including Alzheimer’s Australia; encourages mainstream broadcasters to consider ways of supporting these films and other productions by small independent companies in Scotland, and wishes the Soundsmove production team every success at the New York Independent Film Festival. Supported by: Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Stewart Maxwell*, Kenneth Gibson*, Sandra White*, Rob Gibson*, Stuart McMillan*, Bill Kidd*, Bob Doris*, Robin Harper*
S3M-7802 Scottish Short Films Accepted for New York Independent Film Festival (lodged on 26 January 2011) Dave Thompson*, Jamie Hepburn*
